body.p: Paragraph B34 requires an entity to determine whether it is a principal or an agent on the basis of whether the nature of the entity’s promise is a performance obligation to provide the specified goods or services itself (ie the entity is a principal) or to arrange for those goods or services to be provided by another party (ie the entity is an agent). Assessing whether the entity controls the specified good or service before it is transferred to the customer is the basis for determining the nature of the entity’s promise.
